citeinfo.title: Gridded risk-targeted spectral response acceleration data and 84th-percentile spectral acceleration data used to calculate the Risk-Targeted Maximum Considered Earthquake (MCER) spectral response accelerations of the 2020 NEHRP Recommended Seismic Provisions, and 2022 ASCE/SEI 7 Standard for the conterminous United States.
citeinfo.geoform: fixed format text files, comma separated values (.csv)

descript.abstract: The Risk-Targeted Maximum Considered Earthquake (MCER) spectral response accelerations of the 2020 NEHRP Recommended Seismic Provisions and 2022 ASCE/SEI 7 Standard are derived from the downloadable data files. For each spectral period and site class, the MCER spectral response acceleration (S_aM) is calculated via the following equation: S_aM = min[ S_aRT , max( S_a84th , S_aDLL ) ] where S_aRT = risk-targeted spectral acceleration S_a84th = 84th-percentile spectral acceleration S_aDLL = deterministic lower limit spectral acceleration
descript.purpose: The data are used to calculate the Risk-Targeted Maximum Considered Earthquake (MCER) spectral response accelerations of the 2020 NEHRP Recommended Seismic Provisions and 2022 ASCE/SEI 7 Standard.

idinfo.useconst: The data are not to be used for areas outside the conterminous United States. Acknowledgment of the U.S. Geological Survey, National Seismic Hazard Mapping Project would be appreciated in products derived from these data.

cntperp.cntorg: U.S. Geological Survey - Geologic Hazards Science Center

attracc.attraccr: This data set is based on a seismological model. The following report provides information on quality assessment for the data set: Petersen, M.D., Shumway, A.M., Powers, P.M., Mueller, C.S., Moschetti, M.P., Frankel, A.D., Rezaeian, S., McNamara, D.E., Luco, N., Boyd, O.S., Rukstales, K.S., Jaiswal, K.S., Thompson, E.M., Hoover, S.M., Clayton, B.S., Field, E.H., and Zeng, Y., 2019, The 2018 Update of the U.S. National Seismic Hazard Model: Overview of Model and Implications, Earthquake Spectra, v. 36, p. 5-41. https://doi.org/10.1177/8755293019878199

dataqual.logic: Gridded data values outside the boundaries of the conterminous United States have been assigned a default value of NaN. Grid points where the 84th-percentile (deterministic) spectral accelerations were not calculated, were assigned a default value of NaN.
dataqual.complete: Data outside the physical boundaries of the United States have been included, although they should not be used.

horizpa.horizpar: The location of features is based on calculations of a seismological model for the study area. The location of each point is considered to be correct within the confines of computer accuracy.

procstep.procdesc: The gridded data are based on the 2018 Update of the U.S. National Seismic Hazard Model. The risk-targeted spectral accelerations are calculated using a suite of hazard curves calculated for an equally spaced grid of points covering the conterminous United States. The 84th-percentile spectral accelerations are also derived from the hazard model. The gridded data contain spectral accelerations for 22 different periods. There are separate files for NEHRP site classes A, B, B/C, C, C/D, D, D/E, and E.

enttyp.enttypd: Risk-targeted spectral accelerations for 22 periods, adjusted for maximum direction, NEHRP site class A (Vs30=1500 m/s).
84th-percentile spectral acceleration for 22 periods, adjusted for maximum direction, NEHRP site class A (Vs30=1500 m/s).
Risk-targeted spectral accelerations for 22 periods, adjusted for maximum direction, NEHRP site class B (Vs30=1080 m/s).
84th-percentile spectral acceleration for 22 periods, adjusted for maximum direction, NEHRP site class B (Vs30=1080 m/s).
Risk-targeted spectral accelerations for 22 periods, adjusted for maximum direction, NEHRP site class B/C (Vs30=760 m/s).
84th-percentile spectral acceleration for 22 periods, adjusted for maximum direction, NEHRP site class B/C (Vs30=760 m/s).
Risk-targeted spectral accelerations for 22 periods, adjusted for maximum direction, NEHRP site class C (Vs30=530 m/s).
84th-percentile spectral acceleration for 22 periods, adjusted for maximum direction, NEHRP site class C (Vs30=530 m/s).
Risk-targeted spectral accelerations for 22 periods, adjusted for maximum direction, NEHRP site class C/D (Vs30=365 m/s).
84th-percentile spectral acceleration for 22 periods, adjusted for maximum direction, NEHRP site class C/D (Vs30=365 m/s).
Risk-targeted spectral accelerations for 22 periods, adjusted for maximum direction, NEHRP site class D (Vs30=260 m/s).
84th-percentile spectral acceleration for 22 periods, adjusted for maximum direction, NEHRP site class D (Vs30=260 m/s).
Risk-targeted spectral accelerations for 22 periods, adjusted for maximum direction, NEHRP site class D/E (Vs30=185 m/s).
84th-percentile spectral acceleration for 22 periods, adjusted for maximum direction, NEHRP site class D/E (Vs30=185 m/s).
Risk-targeted spectral accelerations for 22 periods, adjusted for maximum direction, NEHRP site class E (Vs30=150 m/s).
84th-percentile spectral acceleration for 22 periods, adjusted for maximum direction, NEHRP site class E (Vs30=150 m/s).

overview.eaover: These files contain a grid of points. The first line is the header line. The header line contains the column heading for each subsequent row in the data file. Column headings that start with the characters 'SA' indicate a spectral acceleration at a prescribed period (e.g. SA0P01 denotes spectral acceleration at a period of 0.01-second). Subsequent lines contain the latitude and longitude of the point, followed by the 22 risk-targeted spectral accelerations or 84th-percentile spectral accelerations for that single geographic point. Acceleration values are in units of g.

cntaddr.address: Denver Federal Center, Building 810, Mail Stop 302

distinfo.resdesc: Downloadable fixed format data file in ASCII text format.

Furthermore, the data are released on the condition that neither the USGS nor the U.S. Government may be held liable for any damages resulting from authorized or unauthorized use. Although the data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U.S. Geological Survey, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the display or utility of the data on any other system, or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. The U.S. Geological Survey shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein. Users of the data are advised to read all metadata and associated documentation thoroughly to understand appropriate use and data limitations.

digtinfo.formcont: Gridded data used to determine risk-targeted maximum considered earthquake spectral response accelerations for the conterminous United States for the 2020 NEHRP Recommended Seismic Provisions and 2022 ASCE/SEI 7 Standard.
digtinfo.filedec: Files may need to be decompressed using winzip or similar utility
